item.title: Configure kitty terminal on both Linux and MacOS
item.description: Kitty is cross platform and I use it on both Linux home PC and company Macbook. Sharing the configuration and reuse it is crutial because Kitty is highly scriptable. And changing the configuration once should affect on both of my computers. Sharing the configuration Link to heading For this task, I use git to manage the ~/.config directory. Where most of tools configurations live. For example kitty, neovim, direnv. The problem is ~/.
